required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Improvement of Anxiety Management During a Venous Puncture About Children With a Participatory Entertainment Method
clinical_study.official_title: Improvement of Anxiety Management During a Venous Puncture About Children 3 to 6 Years, With a Participatory Entertainment Method

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to demonstrate an anxiety decrease about children 3 to 6 years during a venous puncture with the "fabrique à histoire".

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to demonstrate an anxiety decrease about children 3 to 6 years during a venous puncture with the "fabrique à histoire".
the study will compare the "fabrique à histoire"(Lunii(R)) with the usual care.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This study is an interventional prospective controlled study with 2 arms: the "fabrique à histoire" arm : production and listening a story by the children the controlled arm: usual care (to sing, blow up a baloon, etc)

primary_outcome.time_frame: During venipuncture, an average of 1,5 hours
primary_outcome.description: Evolution of mYPAS (validated anxiety scale with a scale 23,3 (no anxiety) to 100 (max of anxiety) between T0 (before venipuncture) and T1 (venipuncture). mYPAS is quoted by an extern observator

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 hours
primary_outcome.description: Evolution of mYPAS (validated anxiety scale with a scale 23,3 (no anxiety) to 100 (max of anxiety) between T0 and T2 (after venipuncture). mYPAS is quoted by an extern observator.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Evolution of Self-assessment of pain with the face scale caused by the venous puncture for children 4 to 6 years between T0 and T2 (after venipuncture)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Evolution assessment of pain caused by the venous puncture for children assess by caregivers and measured with FLACC Scale (Face Legs Activity Cry Consolability / 0=no pain and 10=max pain) between T0 and T2 (after venipuncture)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of anxiety caused by the venous puncture for children assess by parents at T2 with an Analogue and Visual Scale (AVS) 10 levels (0=No anxiety 10=max anxiety)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of pain caused by the venous puncture for children assess by parents at T2 with an AVS 10 level (0=No pain 10=max pain)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of venous puncture before success
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Number of venous puncture tentative(s) before success

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Success or not (Yes/No) of the venous puncture

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of time spent performing the act before its success

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of caregivers feedback from the gesture with an AVS 0 (worst feeling) to 10 (best feeling)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of parents feedback from the gesture with an AVS 0 (worst feeling) to 10 (best feeling)

arm_group.description: Children 3 to 6 years in pediatric emergency needing to venous puncture and randomized in the "fabrique à histoire (Lunii(R))" arm in addition to the routine anaesthetic cream patch.
Children 3 to 6 years in pediatric emergency needing to venous puncture and randomized in the habitual care arm in addition to the routine anaesthetic cream patch.

intervention.description: "Fabrique à histoire" is a participatory entertainment method. Children of this arm going to create and listening a story before and during the venous puncture.

It is a passive entertainment method. Children of this arm going to do habitual activities before and during the venous puncture, like to sing, blow up a balloon, to play with recreational thing, etc.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children 3 to 6 years in pediatric emergency needing to venous puncture
- Oral consent by children
- Informed and signed consent by tenured of parent authority
- To have Anaesthetic patch 45 minutes or more before the venous puncture
Exclusion Criteria:
- To have Anaesthetic patch less than 45 minutes before the venous puncture because of necessity to blood test or an other emergency
- Necessity to analgesic 3 emergency
- Necessity to MEOPA
- Minor parents
- Assessment of anxiety is not possible because of comorbidity
- Anterior participation to these study

patient_data.ipd_description: All collected data that underlie results in a publication
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will be available after the publication of result and ending fifteen years following the last visit of the last patient
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Data access requests will be reviewed by the internal committee of Brest University Hospital. Requestors will be required to sign and complete a data access agreement.
